verbs.description: endear (third-person singular simple present endears, present participle endearing, simple past and past participle endeared)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To make (something) more precious or valuable. [16th–17th c.]
(obsolete) To make (something) more expensive; to increase the cost of. [17th–19th c.]
(obsolete) To stress (something) as important; to exaggerate. [17th c.]
To make (someone) dear or precious. [from 18th c.]
examples: By giving candy to the children the man tried to endear himself to them.
